main event: A large ball of fire was observed traveling through the air at low altitude below the clouds, from east to west, near Collins, Ontario, Canada.
interesting points: The object was observed for about 15 minutes, moving at a good speed but not extremely fast.
The weather at the time was reported to be a 4/10 overcast, with cloud cover at 3,000 feet.
The director on duty at the nearby air operations center was asked if his crew had seen anything on the radar, but he stated they had not observed any unidentified objects.
The object was described as a large, oval-shaped ball of fire in color.
The observer, who was located about half a mile from Collins, stated that the object was not an aircraft or weather balloon.
